means: 用符咒迷惑，迷住，使入迷( spellbind的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He was in awe of her; she held him spellbound.
sentence.Network_cn: 他对她十分敬畏；她令他着迷。

sentence.Network_en: His audience had listened like children, spellbound by his words.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的观众像孩子般倾听着，被他的话深深吸引了。

sentence.Network_en: a storyteller who can hold audiences spellbound
sentence.Network_cn: 讲故事能让听众如痴如醉的人

list.abs: The magician kept the children spellbound ., 魔术师把孩子都迷住了.
I was spellbound by the concert., 这场音乐会使我痴醉不已.
The storyteller held the crowd spellbound . Televised sports can ' t hold my interest ., 那个讲故事的人使观众听得入迷了 . 电视播放的体育比赛不能引起我的兴趣.
She can hold an audience spellbound ., 她能够紧紧地抓住观众的兴趣.

entry.def: If you are spellbound by something or someone, you are so fascinated that you cannot think about anything else.

example.ex: His audience had listened like children, spellbound by his words...
example.tran: 他的观众像孩子般倾听着，被他的话深深吸引了。

example.ex: He was in awe of her; she held him spellbound.
example.tran: 他对她十分敬畏;她令他着迷。

means.word_mean: 1. having your attention fixated as though by a spell

auth_sentence.content: A great silence followed as the crowd stood spellbound.
auth_sentence.res_content: A great silence followed as the crowd stood spellbound.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: A great silence followed as the crowd stood spellbound.

auth_sentence.content: Everyone else in the room, though, was spellbound.
auth_sentence.res_content: Everyone else in the room, though, was spellbound.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Everyone else in the room, though, was spellbound.

auth_sentence.content: His musical eloquence left wild beasts spellbound.
auth_sentence.res_content: His musical eloquence left wild beasts spellbound.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His musical eloquence left wild beasts spellbound.

sentences.en: The children were spellbound by the circus performance.
sentences.cn: 孩子们被马戏表演迷住了。

sentences.en: She sat there motionless, as if spellbound.
sentences.cn: 她坐在那儿一动不动,似乎着了魔。
